headline.main: Poughkeepsie Regatta--Second Day's Races.; NEW-YORK WINS FIVE OUT OF TWELVE PRIZES GIVEN IN THE REGATTA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The second day's live-mile races took place yesterday, with the greatest eclat and a much larger attendance than on the first day. Several steamers accompanied the boats. The first race yesterday was for two pair sculls, working boats, in which were three entries; was rowed for by the Maggie, of NewYork, 17 feet, James Culross and John Eckerson,

headline.main: OUR CALIFORNIA CORRESPONDENCE.; Dr. Gwin's Cool Reception A Shining Light Quenched Republicans and People's Party Men Glance at the Crimes, Suicides, Insenity, &co., of the City for the Year Past A Great Discovery.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. GWIN, "the daily mail-killer," is home again. On the day of his arrival a military company fired 30 guns for the departure of its Captain, but not a fire cracker exploded on the Senator's account. Nobody gave him a dinner. Nobody made much of him. Nobody has spoken well of him. He is a shrewd man, however, and will go back to the Untited States Senate if he wishes, without a question.

headline.main: THE PRESIDENCY.; Speech of Hon. John C. Breckinridge, at Lexingtion, Ky. DISCUSSION OF THE ISSUES OF THE CAMPAIGN. His Vindication from the Charge ofBeing a Disunionist.The Question of Regularity as Between Douglas and Himself. REVIEW OF THE CONVENTION PROCEEDINGS Personal History He Did Not Sign a Petition forthe Pardon of John Brown He Did Not Vote for Taylor for the Presidency He Did Not Do a Great Many Other Things with which he has been Charged.

docs.lead_paragraph: Everything was propitious for the gathering today. At an early hour to-day the roads from all directions were crowded with people. docs.snippet: The large number of arrivals from Southern ports during the past week has caused quite a collection of vessels at and about the old anchorage. On Saturday we counted twenty-five, and on Sunday eighteen, and on Monday and Tuesday the number was still...

headline.main: The Health of the Port.; THE STATEN ISLANDERS ALARMED.

docs.lead_paragraph: The large number of arrivals from Southern ports during the past week has caused quite a collection of vessels at and about the old anchorage. On Saturday we counted twenty-five, and on Sunday eighteen, and on Monday and Tuesday the number was still further diminished.

docs.snippet: Notwithstanding the decided appearance of rain this morning, the Republican demonstration, to-day, has been a decided success.

headline.main: THE PRESIDENTIAL CANVASS.; SLAVERY AND PARTY SPIRIT. Important Speech of Senator Seward at Detroit THE CRISIS AND ITS REQUIREMENTS. DUTY OF REPUBLICANS. An Immense Demonstration--Great Enthusiasm.

docs.lead_paragraph: Notwithstanding the decided appearance of rain this morning, the Republican demonstration, to-day, has been a decided success.

headline.main: OUR PUBLIC GARDENS.; Visit to Jones' Woods, Columbia, Bellevue and Conrad Gardens, and Mill Rock. The People who go There, and What they do. The Peoplke who go There, and What they do. JONES' WOOD. VIEW OF HELL GATE AND ITS SURROUNDINGS. LAGER BEER AND SCUPPING. A TARTAR. GAMBLING FOR SLEEVE-BUTTONS. WHY YOU DON'T WIN. GOING ROUND AND ROUND. RINGS AND SPIKES. A FAMILIAR FACE.
